section.name: 10 - Circular Motion
section.summary:
Objectives

By the end of this topic unit you should be able to:

  • Draw conclusions about the accelerations of objects moving in a circle at constant or non-constant speed.
  • Draw a free body diagram for an object moving in a circle, including selecting an appropriate perspective from which to draw the diagram.
  • Explain the meanings of angular position, angular velocity, angular acceleration, tangential acceleration and radial acceleration.
  • Solve problems in which an object moves with constant angular acceleration.
  • Solve problems in which we relate velocity and acceleration of an object with the forces acting on the object, where the object is moving in a circle.
